newsitem.title: UK: French fast-breeder to hit 90 pct capacity - agency.
newsitem.headline: French fast-breeder to hit 90 pct capacity - agency.

text.p: France's Superphenix prototype fast-breeder nuclear reactor has been given the go-ahead to increase its power output to 90 percent from 60 percent by the DSIN, the French nuclear authority, the nuclear industry news agency NucNet said on Tuesday.
Supherphenix opeators NERSA said the 90 percent power level would probably be achieved on Wednesday.
The 60 billion franc Superphenix reactor has been dogged by problems since it was commissioned 20 years ago and has operated for only a dozen months.

The facility currently operates as a research and development site looking into the recyling of nuclear waste, well short of its origninal design as a fast-breeder producing more plutonium than it burns when generating electricity.
The 1,240 megawatt reactor was shut down this summer for two and a half months for maintenance.
The DSIN said another shut-down was scheduled for January 1997 with the aim of reducing the fast-breeder character of the reactor.
Nuclear power accounts for 81 percent of electricity production in France with hydro power at 15 percent, coal three and oil or gas only one percent.
